data.title: Pedicures
data.text: I've visited The Woodhouse Day Spa several times for pedicures. Never experienced any of their other services. Nice atmosphere and drink of your choice is offered. However, not especially impressed by their technicians. I didn't feel that the pedicures I've had there were worth the high price when compared with other establishments in Victoria.

data.title: Feel Better
data.text: My wife loves this place.  She would go every week if possible.  A great place to relax and get pampered.

data.title: Beautiful Experience
data.text: Woodhouse offers a very nice experience.  Over the years I have had massages, pedicures, manicures and all have been excellent.  The atmosphere is serene and upscale.

data.title: Massage
data.text: My husband and I go to the one on Wheeler frequently.   We have problems getting the times and days we want.   They have big turnovers in staff.  Accommodation's are nice.  The robes are soft and comfortable.   Staff is nice.  You don't always get what you paid for.   They short you on time and technique.  Sometimes the massage is just a big lotion rub.  But they are the only big facility in Victoria.

data.title: Nothing special
data.text:
I went for a facial, massage and pedicure, redeeming some gift certificates I got for my birthday (thanks guys!). This is my favorite gift--things I don't do for myself and also don't sit on a shelf!
I am not a believer in facials--they are relaxing, but don't really do anything for your skin--but it was a package, so enjoy, right? And I did! The massage I got during the facial was better than the actual massage. She was attentive to her job and let me lead on conversation. Very relaxing.
The massage wasn't great. The masseuse didn't seem there and didn't use enough pressure. She was small, so maybe just not strong enough. I just know I had been looking forward to it for months and was disappointed. 
The pedicure was also so-so. The technician was very inattentive and it was just a pedicure, not even as good as the one I usually get for $25. (I think the basic is $40 here). 
They also use scents constantly, in every step and I'm not a fan. The facility is nice (I went downtown) and the robes are super. I'll only go back with a gift card.

data.title: Nice relaxing visit.
data.text:
I booked a pedi and massage. Both were very nice. Timely and professional service. The receptionist offered a beverage and took me upstairs(hot up there probably from afternoon heat) to change into a comfy robe. Then I had the massage first. The lady was very pleasant. The 
Massage room had the typical spa music playing. Afterwards I clothed and went back downstairs for pedi. 
I noticed that they offer "spa party" packages.
